[24] Let me clarify, Eep. The world is ending.

[26]I've seen it. It's coming this way. First, the Earth is going to shake. Then it breaks open. Everything falls in. Fire. Lava. I don't mean to sound too dramatic, but Aaaaaaaugh. Believe me, everything we're standing on, all this right here, will be gone. 
[27]We've got to get to high ground. I know a mountain, that way--

[76]Okay. But it won't be as good as Grug's. Um, once upon a time, there was a beautiful tiger. She lived in a cave with the rest of her family. Her father and mother told her, "You may go anywhere you want but never go near the cliff, for you could fall." 
[77]But when no one was looking, she would go near the cliff, for the closer she came to the edge, the more she could hear, the more she could see, the more she could feel. Finally, she stood at the very edge, and she saw a light. She leaned out to touch it, and slipped. 
[78]And she flew. 
[79]Tomorrow. 
[80]A place with more suns in the sky than you can count.

dialogues.Eep:
[1]With every sun comes a new day. A new beginning. A hope that things will be better today than they were yesterday. 
[2]But not for me. My name's Eep. This, is my family, the Croods. If you weren't clued in already by the animal skins and sloping foreheads - we're cavemen. Most days we spend in our cave, in the dark. Night after night, day after day. Yep. Home sweet home. When we did go out, we struggled to find food in a harsh and hostile world. And I struggled to survive my family. 
[3]We were the last ones around. There used to be neighbors. The Gorts, smashed by a mammoth. The Horks, swallowed by a sand snake. The Erfs, mosquito bite. Throgs, common cold. And, the Croods. That's us. The Croods made it... 
[4]Because of my Dad. He was strong... and he followed the rules. 
[5]... the ones painted on the cave walls. Anything new is bad, curiosity is bad, going out at night is bad. Basically, anything fun is bad. Welcome to my world. 
[6]But this is a story about how all that changed in an instant. 
[7]Because what we didn't know, was that our world was about to come to an end. And there were no rules on our cave walls to prepare us for that. 
[8]We've been in that cave forever. 
[9]It is with this family. 
[10]Heads. 
[11] 
[12]Thanks! 
[13]Heads Up! 
[14]Please come back tomorrow. 
[15]Okay, okay! 
[16]

[149]You really need to see this. 
[150]This is me. My name's Eep. And this, is my family. The Croods. If you weren't clued in by the sun tans and pets, we're not exactly cavemen anymore. 
[151]Our world is still plenty harsh and hostile. But now we know the Croods will make it. 
[152]Because we changed the rules. The ones that kept us in the dark. 
[153]And because of my dad, who taught us that anyone can change... 
[154]Well, sort of. 
[155]So from now on we'll stay out here. 
[156]Where we can follow the light.

[55]A long time ago, this little bear was alive. She was alive because she listened to her father and lived her life in routine and darkness and terror. So she was happy. But Krispy had one, terrible problem. She was filled with... curiosity.
